intro: Gouania mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican gouania, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate to lanceolate in shape, and have a slightly hairy surface. Gouania mexicana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streambanks.
